• Referee details. Please provide the contact details of one or two referees on your application as required. You should provide details of an academic referee if you are currently studying, or if you have graduated within the last five years. Professional references may be considered if you have graduated more than five years ago.
• Your academic referee(s) may already have provided you with a reference that you can use to support any application for study or research that you make. We call these ‘open’ references. Open references will normally only be accepted if they are written on headed paper, provided as a colour copy of the original, and provide the referee’s work contact details.
• If you have open references, please upload these at the time of application If you do not have open reference, we will contact your referee(s) via email to supply a reference, preferably electronically. Please note, we can only accept a reference provided by email if it is sent from a university or company email address. References from a personal email address such as 'Yahoo' or 'Hotmail' are not acceptable.
• Your referee(s) can also supply a paper reference in response to the reference request email your referee will receive. Paper reference forms should be endorsed by an appropriate institution/company stamp or on official institution/company letterhead, and should be provided as a scanned colour copy of the original.
• Statement of purpose. Your statement of purpose should explain why you want to study your chosen programme and how it will help your future career aspirations. This should typically be one side of A4 paper.
• Curriculum Vitae (CV)/Resume
• English language certificate (if applicable). If English is not your first language, you should provide evidence of English language ability: IELTS, TOEFL, or other acceptable proof. Please see the English Language Requirements section for more details.
• Your academic referee(s) may already have provided you with a reference that you can use to support any application for study or research that you make. We call these ‘open’ references. Open references will normally only be accepted if they are written on headed paper, provided as a colour copy of the original, and provide the referee’s work contact details.
• If you have open references, please upload these at the time of application If you do not have open reference, we will contact your referee(s) via email to supply a reference, preferably electronically. Please note, we can only accept a reference provided by email if it is sent from a university or company email address. References from a personal email address such as 'Yahoo' or 'Hotmail' are not acceptable.
• Your referee(s) can also supply a paper reference in response to the reference request email your referee will receive. Paper reference forms should be endorsed by an appropriate institution/company stamp or on official institution/company letterhead, and should be provided as a scanned colour copy of the original.

Expertise: | Prof Sobrido's research focuses in the development of new sustainable materials for energy storage and conversion applications. Queen Mary University of London is one of the UK’s top research universities, with the vast majority – 92% – of our research submissions assessed as internationally excellent or world-leading (REF 2021).
Explore our PhD programmes and apply using our online application forms.
When you join Queen Mary, you become part of a thriving community of 1,800 PhD students. You will have access to the Graduate Centre, numerous sources of funding, and researcher development training too, all supported by our dedicated Doctoral College team. Our home in London makes Queen Mary an ideal place to conduct your research, surrounded by some of the world’s best museums, libraries, institutes, and archives.
Please use the search tool below, powered by FindaPhD.com, to search our advertised PhD projects. Not all opportunities are advertised here. Please check the departmental PhD pages for full instructions and project lists.
Find out more about the PhD application process at Queen Mary.
Those with external funding are welcome to discuss projects and vacancies directly with the academic Schools. Browse the list of contacts for your subject area.

[HEADING] The Queen Mary Education Approach
Queen Mary University of London's 2030 Strategy sets out our ambition to deliver "an outstanding, inclusive, world-class education and student experience, co-created with our diverse student body, enhanced by our world-leading research and latest technological developments".
'Our Approach to Education: Opening the doors of opportunity' describes how we are working to achieve this ambition. In this publication, you will find out what is distinctive about our approach including an explanation of our four Pillars of excellence, how we are bringing our Approach to life through our five Interrelated Components, and the language we use to help ensure consistency and understanding.
Queen Mary was rated Silver in the Teaching Excellence Framework (TEF) 2023

Apply for an undergraduate programme starting this September through Clearing.
From Accounting to Zoology, we have a range of undergraduate study options.
Our Access and Participation Plan sets out our commitment to widening participation and includes the measures we have put in place around outreach work and support for students from widening participation backgrounds. Access and participation plans are approved by the Director of Fair Access and Participation at the Office for Students. You can view a copy of our latest plan on our Queen Mary Access and Particpation Plan page or the Office for Students webpage.
